meanings.definition: A wasteful or impractical project or activity.
meanings.sent1: The company's team-building retreat turned into a boondoggle when they spent the entire day playing games instead of working.
meanings.sent2: The government's new initiative was criticized as a boondoggle by taxpayers who felt their money was being wasted.
meanings.sent3: The school's attempt to improve student performance by adding unnecessary technology became a boondoggle when the devices malfunctioned.
meanings.sent4: The construction of the new stadium turned into a boondoggle when delays and cost overruns plagued the project.
meanings.sent5: The boondoggle of a fundraiser left the organizers scrambling to cover the expenses with very little to show for it.

meanings.definition: To waste time or money on unnecessary or frivolous activities.
meanings.sent1: Instead of studying for the exam, he chose to boondoggle by watching TV all day.
meanings.sent2: She realized she had been boondoggling her time away on social media instead of focusing on her work.
meanings.sent3: The group decided to boondoggle their afternoon away by taking a leisurely stroll in the park.
meanings.sent4: He knew he was boondoggling his savings by constantly buying things he didn't need.
meanings.sent5: The team's lack of progress was due to their tendency to boondoggle during work hours instead of being productive.
